headline: Mississippi Chicken
description: Mississippi chicken recipe uses only 4 ingredients and can be cooked in the oven or in the slow cooker.
name: Mississippi Chicken
recipeIngredient: 1 (1 ounce) package dry ranch dressing mix (such as Hidden Valley Ranch®)
1 (16 ounce) jar sliced pepperoncini peppers, drained

recipeInstructions.text: Gather ingredients, and preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Season chicken with ranch seasoning mix; place in bottom of large Dutch oven.

Place pepperoncini peppers, butter, and 1/2 cup reserved pepper juice over chicken. Cover, and bake in preheated oven until chicken is fork tender, about 1 hour 30 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
Let stand 5 minutes. Shred chicken using two forks.

review.reviewBody: Why do you all seem to think Mississippians cook with pepperoncini? I was born and raised in Mississippi, taught to cook by 3 Southern women, and not one of us would ruin a meal by putting a pepperoncini in it! Pepperoncini is something on the side of pizza that you throw away! Cut the salt!

I'd give 3.5 stars if I could. It's almost there and just needs to be tweaked. After reading all the reviews about how salty it was I did the following which helped: 1) rinse the pepperoncinis under cold water in a mesh strainer, and 2) use 1/4 cup of reserved pepperoncini liquid and 1/4 cup of water, instead of 1/2 cup reserved liquid. The above modifications definitely reduces the sodium content. The finished product was not overly salty at all and I used the Hidden Valley Ranch dry ranch dressing mix as per the recipe. The issue I ran into was how dry the chicken became. I followed the cook's note and prepared this dish in the slow cooker on LOW for 6 hours. At the end the meat registered 205F on the instant thermometer and there was very little liquid left at the bottom of the slow cooker. The flavors are all there, a nice tang from the pepperoncinis but the chicken is too dry for my taste. To salvage what I made I plan to mix in some BBQ sauce to introduce some moisture. If you were to do this in the slow cooker I would try adding more liquid and maybe checking the temp of the meat at the 5 hour mark.

I really like this a lot. I used less peppers and ranch dressing mix because I didn’t want it to be too spicy or salty. I served it with small dinner rolls. It was delicious and so easy. Thank you for sharing this recipe.

I agree about the saltiness. It comes from the ranch dressing and pepperoncini. The only way to control the salt is to make the 2 condiments yourself to control salt. I made this with beef- awesome with egg noodles- but too salty

Too salty…unless one knows how to make their own Ranch dressing. 1/3 c. Dry buttermilk powder, 1 T garlic powder, 1 T onion powder, 2 tsp dried parsley, 1 1/2 tsp dill weed and dried chives, 1/2 tsp sugar and dried tarragon, 1/4 tsp black pepper and mustard powder. Add up to 1 tsp salt…or none!
Made it as written. Hated it

Great recipe. I make mine in crockpot and use unsalted butter. I add a packet of onion soup mix. Put the shredded meat on buns with provolone wrap them in foil and heat in the oven until cheese is melted. Wonderful meal!
Awesome way to use up pepperoncini!
I did it in the slow cooker, added some chicken broth and some McCormick's Au Jus seasoning mix for depth and umami = Yummami!

This was extremely salty. It is 131% salt. For us with heart conditions or just prefer a truly healthy diet, we’d like to see more recipes without so much sodium. I was excited to try this until I read the nutritional info. If anyone has any suggestions about how to to make this with less and 30% sodium we’d love to see it.
Since my hubby loves peperoncinis, I decided to make this easy dish. I served it with buttered calrose rice and he was a happy camper. Thanks for the idea of this recipe!
I cut the recipe in half and made it in my slow cooker. I served it on buns with provolone cheese. It’s a spicy sandwich which packs a little bit of heat.
I've made this about 4 times family always loves it. I use salted butter.
